frameDefinitions: These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items.
An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.
A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works.
An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.
This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.
Procedural or Medicine based Interventions are used on a Patient to attempt to alleviate a Medical_condition.
frameExamples: The players <t>emptied</t> the bucket over his head.
As it turns out, putting all of my eggs in one basket completely <t>solved</t> all of my problems.
Sun has (hopefully) already <t>tested</t> it for compliance.
Isis then <t>cured</t> Re by reciting a spell.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that does the emptying.
The <fen>Theme</fen>, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by 'of'.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the <fen>Source</fen> occurs as an NP Object.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying.
The time at which the emptying takes place.
The location where the emptying takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or <fen>Problem</fen>.
The <fen>Problem</fen> is the predicament or mystery that is resolved.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the <fen>Problem</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
This role indicates the location at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
The person who uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.
The entity that the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity or property whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Product</fen>.
An action that the <fen>Tester</fen> intends to accomplish subjecting the <fen>Product</fen> to a test of its functioning.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Tester</fen> hopes to find to obtain when using the <fen>Product</fen>.
A variable of behavior of the <fen>Product</fen> which is specifically evaluated.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to evaluate its functioning.
The location in which the test is carried out.
The <fen>Agent</fen>'s breathing causes the motion of the <fen>Air</fen>.  <fen>Agent</fen> is generally the External Argument.
<fen>Air</fen> is the substance that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to move.
The time at which breathing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the breathing occurs.
The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs:

This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  role Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.
The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Patient</fen>'s body which is treated.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A drug or procedure is administered or performed in order to treat a <fen>Medical_condition</fen>.
The consequence of the <fen>Intervention</fen>.
A holistic description of the medical state of the patient (or a part of the state of the patient), which may or may not indicate the cause of a deviation from normal.
The individual or team that attempts to improve the medical condition of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> cleared the table of dishes.
Pat cleared the table <fex>of dishes</fex>.
Pat cleared <fex>the table</fex>.
<fex>A basic washing</fex> can degrease your workclothes.
The prisoners were deloused <fex>in June and August</fex>.
Don't eviscerate him <fex>in the house</fex>!
If <fex>we</fex> have not been able to resolve a problem to your satisfaction, please email us.
Likewise, once the students worked through <fex>the problem</fex> and obtained their results, their next assignment would be to publish these to the web.
First, <fex>the Tripartite Agreement of 1979</fex> actually solved the only significant friction between the two countries.
A group of international scientists solved the fundamental particle hierarchy question <fex>at an underground accelerator</fex>.
I just wish <fex>we</fex> could have tested the car with a manual gearbox, instead of the five-speed automatic
To ensure that the remedy is complete, nCipher have fully reviewed the software and tested it <fex>for similar errors</fex>.
Once you have copied your site and have tested it <fex>to make sure it works normally</fex>, you're ready to pull out the scalpel and start hacking away.
Test-Driven Development requires you to set an expectation of a result and then test <fex>that the result is achieved</fex>.
ILCSO staff have tested <fex>the behavior of the ILCSO-standard version of WebVoyage with several browsers</fex>.
We tested the product <fex>in California</fex> first.
<fex>Lee</fex> breathed the hot desert air.
Lee breathed <fex>the hot desert air</fex>.
All I know is that he was still breathing <fex>at 2AM</fex>.
Lee breathed with difficulty <fex>on the track</fex>.
<fex>Doctors</fex> alleviated his suffering.
Acupuncture cured <fex>Pat</fex> of his depression.
This potion heals <fex>a broken heart</fex>.
He emphasized treatment <fex>by surgical means</fex>.
He needs prolonged treatment <fex>with anibiotics</fex>.
